parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party.  It promotes a website that helps voters find compatible parties, but doesn't endorse any particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience of Romanian voters.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post relates to the parliamentary elections, its objective is not to directly influence the vote for a specific candidate. The aim is to encourage voter participation and informed decision-making by providing a tool to find compatible political parties.  It does not advocate for or against any particular candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of public service announcement or citizen journalism, aiming to educate and inform voters about the electoral process. It provides a resource (website) to help voters make informed choices.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it presents a tool for voter engagement.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1101485344697801</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a website designed to help voters find politically compatible parties.  While related to the parliamentary elections, it doesn't advocate for or against any specific candidate or party. The objective is to encourage informed voting, not to influence the outcome in favor of a particular candidate. The content is educational and informative, similar to a public service announcement.  The absence of any endorsement of a specific candidate or party, combined with the educational nature of the post, suggests it does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>DifinePR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
